examples: A decade ago, Whitley became enamored of romance and gave writing a whirl.
John was so enamored by Sarah that he wanted to know her in the biblical sense.
As the couple sat in the park, they exchanged goo-goo eyes, completely enamored with each other.
Some locals are also enamored.
I was enamored by the beauty of martial arts, the physicality, the grace and the speed.
words.defineVi: thu hút; nguyên nhân để được say mê

examples: Nature abhors a vacuum, so if you don't fill the garden bed with plants, weeds will quickly take over.
Nature abhors a vacuum!
How can anyone who abhors the oppression of negroes be in favor of degrading classes of white people?
If you pull a vacuum on the inside of the tube, nature abhors a vacuum, so if you quickly vent one side to atmosphere, all the air will rush into the pipe and it'll push the golf ball down the tube.
words.defineEn: to hate a behavior or way of thought, believing that it is morally wrong
words.defineVi: ghét một hành vi hoặc cách suy nghĩ, tin rằng đó là sai trái về mặt đạo đức

examples: And those proctors either had somebody else take the test for these students, or they corrected the exam, so that the students would get higher scores.

words.defineEn: watch over (students taking an exam, to prevent cheating)
words.defineVi: giám sát (học sinh làm bài kiểm tra, để ngăn chặn gian lận)

examples: As a kid, I used to enjoy picking off the maraschino cherries from my mom's homemade fruitcake before devouring the rest of it.

The chickens pecked at the corncob, eagerly devouring the remaining bits of corn.
As a leader, it's important to be confident and assertive, because make yourself all honey and the flies will devour you.
They devour hydroids.
Stan, at this point aren’t we sort of belaboring the fact that China invented fireworks?

examples: It’s hardly the cheapest endeavor.

examples: The Grant administration wanted to annex it and the Dominican Republic, but Congress demurred.
words.defineEn: to express one's disagreement, refusal, or reluctance
words.defineVi: để bày tỏ sự không đồng ý, từ chối, hoặc miễn cưỡng của một người

examples: My husband decides to procure fireworks.

Since Jefferson was living in France, his friend General John Sullivan made it his personal mission to procure the animal on Jefferson’s behalf.

words.defineVi: có được bằng nỗ lực đặc biệt

examples: I accrued tens of thousands of dollars in bills.
With these loans, the government pays any interest that accrues on the loan while the student is still in school.
Time is on the side of the robo-advisory industry as the technology continues to improve and the younger generations accrue more wealth.
But if you opt in, then you're foregoing benefits that are accruing from certain other programs.
That’s because banks make their profits by accruing interest on your money.
words.defineEn: (particularly related to money) to gradually increase in amount or number

examples: Smaller capitalist countries are maneuvering to gain a bigger share of the pie.

words.defineEn: direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
words.defineVi: chỉ đạo khóa học; xác định hướng di chuyển

examples: To recover his glasses, the scientist darted to his car like a scalded cat and clambered quickly in.

words.defineEn: climb awkwardly, as if by scrambling

examples: Now, this manic episode must impair our ability to function in our life, socially, at work or school.

examples: That resolution clearly withered on the vine.
